explanation: The code assumed b and c could be obtained from the first and last characters of the raw input string (a[0] and a[-1]), which fails when the dimensions are multi-digit or when the input contains a space-separated pair like "3 4". By changing the input line to split the input into tokens (a = input().split()), the subsequent int(a[0]) and int(a[-1]) correctly parse the two numbers regardless of spacing or digit count.
